page.title: 01HISTORY GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area covered by this survey is a mainly rural area in which is the village of Steeple Ashton, part of the village of Keevil and a small part of the hamlet of Great Hinton.At one time, most of the area belonged to the Long family who had its home in the area (Steeple Ashton Manor and Rood Ashton). There is a mixture of farming, arable,dairy and beef:some sheep and pigs are kept: There are also chicken farms.There are a few small haulage firms in the area and other small businesses. Although some people work in the villages most commute to work, some as far as London. It is a popular area in which to live as the villages themselves are not on any main road & therefore quiet and peaceful,but within easy reach of nearby towns.
